doc:
Lloyd Battista https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Battista 0 Lloyd McAteer Battista (born May 14, 1937 in Cleveland, Ohio) is an American actor and screenwriter. Battista studied acting at the Carnegie Institute of Technology. He was active on Broadway and off-Broadway stages, appearing in productions of plays such as Sexual Perversity in Chicago and The Homecoming. His television roles ranged from the CBS soap opera Love of Life in the 1950s and the mini-series James A. Michener's Texas in 1994. He appeared in movies such as Chisum (1970), Love and Death (1975), and In Hell (2003). On the radio, Battista was heard between 1974 and 1982 on the CBS Radio Mystery Theater. He also wrote The Nose Knows, a guide to Los Angeles area restaurants. Lloyd_McAteer_Battista ( born May_14_,_1937 in Cleveland , Ohio ) is an_American_actor_and_screenwriter . Battista studied_acting at the_Carnegie_Institute of Technology . He was active on Broadway and off-Broadway_stages , appearing in productions of plays such_as Sexual_Perversity in Chicago and The_Homecoming . His_television_roles ranged from the_CBS_soap_opera_Love of Life in the_1950s and the_mini-series_James_A._Michener 's_Texas in 1994 . He appeared in movies such_as Chisum_(_1970_)_,_Love_and_Death_(_1975_) , and In Hell_(_2003_) . On the_radio , Battista was_heard between 1974_and_1982 on the_CBS_Radio_Mystery_Theater . He also wrote The_Nose Knows , a_guide to Los_Angeles_area_restaurants .
